NVIDIA.content: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) Latest Stock News & Headlines - Yahoo Finance ### Nvidia Stock Price Levels to Watch as Earnings Report Looms Nvidia shares are in the spotlight ahead of the AI darling’s quarterly results later this week and following a report that the company’s next-generation Blackwell chips have encountered issues overheating in servers. ### These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nvidia, Super Micro, Tesla, Uber, Palantir, Robinhood, and More Nvidia stock falls ahead of the AI chip maker’s quarterly earnings later this week, while Super Micro Computer is expected Monday to submit a plan to allow it to continue to trade on the Nasdaq. ### Investors Jump Into Nvidia Stock-Options Bets Nvidia results have become a major Wall Street event, drawing comparisons with Federal Reserve meetings and key economic reports for their influence over the broader market.

Exclusive-Nvidia delays launch of new China-focused AI chip -sources
Nvidia has told customers in China it is delaying the launch of a new artificial intelligence chip it designed to comply with U.S. export rules until the first quarter of next year, two sources familiar with the matter said.
 The delayed chip is the H20, the most powerful of three China-focused chips Nvidia has developed to comply with fresh U.S. export restrictions, the sources said, and could complicate its efforts to preserve market share in China against local rivals like Huawei.

Government.title: government bonds: Latest News & Videos, Photos about government bonds ...
Government.content: Japan's five-year government bond yield soared to a 15-year high, driven by a weakening yen and speculation of a potential interest rate hike by the Bank of Japan. The yen's decline to a five-month low against the US dollar, fueled by expectations of increased government bond issuance, further exacerbated the situation. 13 Nov, 2024, 11:51 AM IST

Government.title: Bonds Have Banner Day as Inflation Report Revives Fed-Cut Bets
Government.content: (Bloomberg) -- US government bonds had their best day in months after benign inflation data revived the case for additional Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts. “The report gives support to those in the market and at the Fed that the next move by the Fed is still to ease rates,” said Jack McIntyre, portfolio manager at Brandywine Global Investment Management. Along with resilient US economic data, its re-acceleration had suggested that the Fed — which cut rates three times last year by a combined 100 basis points to arrest an increase in unemployment — may have acted prematurely. In the US market, the amount of Fed easing priced in by year end increased by 10 basis points to about 35 basis points, with a quarter-point cut fully priced in by July versus September previously.

Government.title: Bond market turmoil: what it means for pensions, savings and ...
Government.content: Bond market turmoil earlier this month drove the UK 10-year gilt yield up to 4.9%, the highest figure recorded since 2008. The gilt yield has since dipped slightly to 4.6% as the government has sought to reassure a jittery market, but Chancellor Rachel Reeves has faced pressure to announce tax and spending changes in response to the higher cost of government borrowing.

Don't ignore the tenets of diversification and shun tech or the growthier side of the market when adjusting your portfolio to include the best stocks to buy now, says Tony DeSpirito, managing director and portfolio manager at BlackRock. The 12 Best Stocks to Buy Now
Our list of the best stocks to buy now reflect the lesson of the past few years: Be ready for anything.
 The shares are up more than 88% for the year-to-date, but trade at 39 times expected earnings for the year ahead – in line with the typical price-earnings multiple over the past five years.
